com.example.meditrackr.adapters.careprovider

Class PatientAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<PatientAdapter.ViewHolder>
      • com.example.meditrackr.adapters.careprovider.PatientAdapter

  • public class PatientAdapter
extends android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<PatientAdapter.ViewHolder>
    This class displays information about all of the patients that a Care Provider is assigned to in a recycler view (a type of list view). There is also an onclick listener, which when clicked will take the Care Provider to a page with more detailed information about a particular patient (this is the ProblemAdapter). It uses onCreateView to create the recycler view and uses onBindViewHolder to put the patient's information into the recycler view. This class can use getItemCount to display the number of items (patients) in the recycler view. This class uses viewHolder to put information about each patient into its own view so we won't display information from one patient as another. This function mainly serves an organizational purpose.
    See Also:
    ProblemAdapter
